correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
MATTHEW J. McDERMOTT, JR.; M.D;.
708 FOULK ROAD
WILMINGTON, DELAWARE 19803
Telephone: 762-2263
IMMUNIZATION RECORD
Illustration created by Jan Brett Bowler
CREATIVE PAPERS
[A transcription of this page is not available.]
Christopher A. Mosher
12-11 Brook Drive, Wilmington, Delaware 19803
(302)764-0417
OBJECTIVE
COMPUTER PROGRAMMER-Develop software applications or systems.
EDUCATION
Bachelor of Science (Dec. 1987) MAJOR: Computer Science
Syracuse University, Syracuse, NY MINOR: Logic
Dean's List (5 semesters) GPA: 3.5
CAPABILITIES
Write structured programs in numerous languages:
Assembly (PDP, 65C02) JCL (JES 2)
Pascal (Standard, IBM Turbo) FORTRAN (WATFIVE)
BASIC (VAX, Apple) PL/1
LISP (VAX, UCI) Algol
C-(VAX) APL (array processing)
Work with various machines, mainframe or micro.
Accurately and completely document all routines.
Conform to company's programming and documenting style.
Work well with programming team.
Debug and test others' programs.
Program In variety of subject areas.
Quickly learn new languages, machines, operating systems.
ACCOMPLISHMENTS
Develop and test large applications on personal micro (ongoing).
Worked with team of four developing dating service program.
Wrote full-screen font editor application to interface with character generator program.
Wrote natural language sentence parser application.
Developed number-crunching program (with partner) for chemical company that reduced
manhours and increased accuracy.
Wrote programs (with partner) used by high school teachers:
Test grader/score analyzer
Teacher attendance system
WORK EXPERIENCE
9/87-12/87 Residential Security Aide Syracuse University, Syracuse, NY
Communicated with people regarding security
rules. Guarded entry to building.
6/87-9/87 Peripheral Operator Hercules, Inc., Wilmington, DE
Operated IBM 3480 tape drives. Reorganized
microfiche collection. Maintained tape library.
1/87-5/87 Residential Security Aide Syracuse University, Syracuse, NY
5/86-9/86 Professional Handyman Barry Mosher, Newark, DE
5/85-9/85 Professional Handyman Barry Mosher, Newark, DE
PERSONAL
Enjoy: computers, genealogy, guitar.
SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY:
:FOUNDED A.D. 1870
SUOS
CULTORES
SCIENTIA
CORONAT
The School of
Computer and information Science
cordially invites you to a
Convocation and Reception
in honor of
the Class of 1988
on May 14, 1988.
Convocation: 1:30 pm
John G. Alibrandi Catholic Center
110 Walnut Place
(Reception immediately following)
Parking Available:
E16 (entrance on Walnut Place)
C5 (entrance on University Avenue)
Attention Graduates: Cap and gown required to
participate in CIS Convocation.
Contact S.U. Bookstore at 423-4195.
